splash.title: THE RECALL RUN
splash.subtitle: A 'Hardware is Hard' Simulation
splash.description: You are the CTO. Your goal: Ship the product. Obstacles: Physics, Supply Chain, and your own Marketing team. Survive 5 years without bankrupting the company or triggering a recall.

simulation.shipFirmware: Push a 'Premium Feature' OTA update to drive immediate sales.

full.label: Mil-Spec
full.desc: High Cost, Low Risk. The CFO hates you.

partial.label: Standard
partial.desc: Medium Cost, Medium Risk. Breaking things carefully.

none.label: YOLO Deploy
none.desc: No Cost, High Risk. Chaos mode.

victory.title: SIMULATION COMPLETE
victory.survived: You survived the full product lifecycle!

welcome.title: Welcome to Prophet Labs
welcome.subtitle: The Recall Run: IoT Doom Simulator
welcome.content: Your goal: Keep an IoT device alive for 5 years without going bankrupt or accumulating too much technical debt.

setup_device.title: Choose Your Device
setup_device.content: Each device has different challenges. Check the "Difficulty" rating - harder devices have tighter budgets and more regulatory requirements.

setup_budget.title: Watch Your Budget
setup_budget.content: Money keeps the lights on. If you run out, game over. Maintenance costs drain your budget every month.

sim_doom.title: The Doom Meter
sim_doom.content: This is Technical Debt. Bad decisions add Doom. If it hits 100%, your product fails catastrophically.

sim_ship.title: Generate Revenue
sim_ship.content: Need cash? Deploy a monetized OTA update. It earns revenue but increases Technical Debt (Doom) due to rushed features. You cannot deploy if Doom > 50%.

sim_events.title: Crisis Events
sim_events.content: Random disasters will strike. Regulatory audits, cyberattacks, supply chain issues. Your choices matter.

system.title: System Architecture Status
system.hoverHint: Hover over components to inspect hardware/software stack.

cloud.label: Cloud Backend
cloud.description: The server infrastructure. Infinite scale, infinite cost. Vendor lock-in risk.

network.label: Connectivity
network.description: The attack pipe. Encrypted? Authenticated? Or just open telnet?

compute.label: Silicon (AI/MCU)
compute.description: The brain. Executes code. Susceptible to cloning, glitching, and cosmic rays.

storage.label: Flash Storage
storage.description: Where firmware lives. Cheap NAND corrupts data. Secure enclaves define trust.

power.label: Power & Safety
power.description: Battery management and thermal regulation. Failure means fire.

security.label: Security & Compliance
security.description: Certificates, Keys, and HSMs. The only thing standing between you and a botnet.

changed the requirements three weeks before launch.
ignored every warning from the engineering team.
